alert.note: Alert for Maricopa (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued July 16 at 8:23PM MST until July 16 at 9:15PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... * Until 915 PM MST. * At 822 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from near White Tank Mountain Park to Liberty to near Estrella Mountain Ranch, moving west at 25 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 95 and 126. AZ Route 85 between mile markers 136 and 154. AZ Route 303 between mile markers 105 and 111. Locations impacted include... Avondale, Goodyear, Buckeye, Palo Verde, Perryville, White Tank Mountain Park, Liberty, Painted Rock Dam, Palo Verde Nuclear Generation Station, Wintersburg, Estrella Mountain Ranch, Hassayampa and Arlington. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
